title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
has quit 00:27  has quit 00:32  has quit 06:47  has joined #xwiki 07:13  has joined #xwiki 08:05  has joined #xwiki 08:10  has quit 08:11  has joined #xwiki 08:15  msmeria: good morning 08:15  vmassol: hello 08:15  about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9473# do you know if sorin was starting with version 4.5.4 on postgresql or if it was on another DB? 08:16  probably… I'll do that to try to reproduce 08:17  vmassol: I'm pretty sure he started on Postgresql also 08:17  ok 08:17  we always test in that manner 08:17  ok 08:17  thanks 08:17  np 08:18  has joined #xwiki 08:29  whoa 08:29  markdown? 08:29  like real markdown support? 08:29  yes 08:30  hm. what version do I need for that? 08:30  Inge-: see http://rendering.xwiki.org/ 08:30  there's a table 08:32  sdumitriu: are you fixing https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f4b99e2feb2b537eea3b72e4c71504c5a5603bb2#commitcomment-4129116 now? 08:32  Inge-: XRENDERING-297 add new feature to an already supported markdown syntax 08:33  the table says 3.4 for markdown 1.0 08:33  so you need 3.4+ 08:34  I'm on 5.1, so almost md 1.1 syntax 08:35  rebooting (yeah even on mac you reboot from time to time ;)) 08:36  Next question - how do I enable it? the document syntax dropdown in edit mode shows only XWiki 2.0 and 2.1 08:36  !search PageEditing 08:36  oh maybe here http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/GettingStarted 08:36  Inge-: first link 08:36  !search PageEditing 08:39  found it. 08:40  cool 08:40  so basically add markdown/1.0 to swiki.rendering.syntaxes in xwiki.cfg 08:40  (was a test to see if the doc was any good ;)) 08:40  yep 08:41  well, it felt a little convoluted. 08:42  what could be improved? 08:43  PageEditing is part of the user guide while AdminGuide.Configuration is part of the admin guide (admins decide the syntax accepted on their wikis) 08:43  (if that's what you meant) 08:44  rebooting! 08:44  k 08:45  has quit 08:45  has joined #xwiki 08:45  heh. rendering.xwiki.org talks about 5.2 features, but is running 5.1 08:45  has joined #xwiki 08:48  has joined #xwiki 08:49  yay. our xwiki has an uptime of 321 days. 08:49  I'm tempted to update to latest version (now at 5.1) just wondering if that will cause the link between xwiki and tomcat to break again - or something else ... 08:51  has quit 08:55  Inge-, : 5.2 is not out yet 08:56  AHA! 08:56  I've been thinking I'm living in such a cave, but I'm actually on the latest production version. fair enough :) 08:58  has joined #xwiki 09:00  When is 5.2 expected to be released? 09:00  !search Roadmap 09:01  hmm no luck :) 09:01  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome 09:01  bottom of page for dates 09:01  september. 09:01  although I'm not sure if that date takes into account the slippage on 5.0 and 5.1 09:02  it's up to date 09:02  I must say that the upgrade from 3.x to 5.1 went very very smoothly - only issue was the symlink that got deleted 09:02  it's accurate at +/- 1 week 09:02  (generally +1 and not ?1 ;)) 09:04  Inge-: you should not have symlink issue this time, not change between 5.1 and 5.2 on deb packages 09:09  has quit 09:11  has joined #xwiki 09:11  has quit 09:13  has quit 09:15  has joined #xwiki 09:22  sburjan: FYI I've installed xwiki 4.5.4 and started it on an existing pgsql DB and I get the same problem 09:22  (my DB has version 40001) 09:22  so the problem isn't related to 5.2 nor to my change with unique id 09:22  debugging it 09:23  vmassol: glad you can reproduce it, means it's not my computer 09:32  has joined #xwiki 09:38  ok found the problem, need to think of a solution now ) 09:38  ;) 09:45  what's the problem ? 10:04  has joined #xwiki 10:10  has joined #xwiki 10:12  has joined #xwiki 10:13  Morning :) 10:16  morning 10:19  I was a little unclear yesterday, when describing a problem that I'm having. So I'll try again now ... 10:20  I have configured my server with apache, kerberos and xwiki 4.1.3 10:20  all requests that xwiki sends via javascript (loading of attachment-area, displaying users ...) get's a 401:forbidden, as firebug tells me 10:21  i did already try to allow localhost in the apache settings 10:21  do you have any idea where i could start to solving this? 10:23  (maybe requesting those contents with ht elogged-in user would be a solution. but i don't know how to do this) 10:24  \*the logged 10:39  has quit 10:40  has joined #xwiki 10:41  npst: I don't understand what this has to do with localhost, javascript calls are done from the client so it's should behave exactly as if the user had entered these links himself in the browser 10:41  has joined #xwiki 10:41  has quit 10:41  is now known as 10:44  has quit 10:44  if the browser end up calling http://localhost... links then you issue is more about links generation than authentication 10:44  if that's your issue it probably mean you did not properly configured apache->tomcat proxy 10:45  (tomcat or whatever app server you are using) 10:47  we are generally using mod ajp in apache 10:48  if you have to go through a blind HTTP proxy where XWiki can only see localhost as input you can force a domain in the main wiki descriptor (/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiServerXwiki page) 10:56  has joined #xwiki 10:57  you're right, of course, the browser is not calling localhost. 11:00  but only some of the requests I see in apaches access.log contain my username, others none at all 11:01  maybe I'm looking in the wrong spot. Fact is, those POST and GET requests get a 401 error 11:27  ok. it seems as if the request without username is expected behaviour and always followed by a request WITH credentials. 11:27  however, those requests never get a result, as opposed to when i manually try to open that link. (then i get a nice result set of i.e. xwiki users) 11:29  has quit 11:36  has joined #xwiki 11:40  has joined #xwiki 11:41  has quit 11:46  has quit 11:46  sburjan: fixed, a bit hacky but couldn't find a better solution 11:46  is now known as 11:47  vmassol: note I haven't tested on MySQL 11:47  you should 11:48  (but this problem won't appear on mysql) 11:48  (you can get others though) 11:48  I see the fix is quite complex 11:48  has joined #xwiki 11:54  sburjan: btw this means you guys didn't test a migration since 4.5.3 11:54  (on postgresql/oracle) 11:55  maybe 11:55  it was a long time ago 11:55  not very good 11:55  migrations need to be tested before each major release 11:55  this problem is there since 4.5.4 included 11:56  yepp 11:56  I'll retest migrations after RC1 is out 11:56  please test before 11:56  after RC1 is too late already 11:56  it gives us little margin to fix any issue 11:57  I think marius is working on a fix for the DW 11:57  ok, I'll test tomorrow 11:57  IMO you should retest just after that fix 11:57  yes tomorrow is good 11:57  thanks! 11:57  yes but I also need some margin to do my tests 11:57  np 11:57  you've got all night and week end! :) ahahah 11:57  (kidding) 11:57  let's hope you get enough time 11:57  if not we might want to delay the release 11:58  since so far migrations have failed for workspaces 11:58  and we need that to work well 11:58  well some aspects during the migration failed, indeed. But overall, I was able to have a usable workspace after migration 11:59  but I agree, it's not yet production readyt 12:05  has quit 12:08  has joined #xwiki 12:17  has joined #xwiki 12:22  vmassol: do we have somewhere a best practice guide for internationalizing an application ? how to name keys, etc 12:23  yes and no 12:23  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications and http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/L10N+Conventions 12:24  has joined #xwiki 12:33  has joined #xwiki 12:34  Hello, is there a reason why http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/ doesn't contain xwiki-enterprise-ui-all for 5.2-milestone-2 or is it a glitch? 12:34  oh I know 12:35  the workspace refactoring 12:35  they changed the name I think 12:35  yep it's enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all 12:35  xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all 12:36  sorry for the noise :) 13:30  has joined #xwiki 13:39  msmeria: what did you change on these extensions`? 13:40  vmassol: sorry for that. I didn't change anything 13:40  you edited and saved them without change? 13:40  I just tested something 13:41  ok, you should cancel if you don't make any change 13:41  that avoids unnecessary versions 13:41  I clicked on the  Extension Version link which automatically added an object and created a new version 13:42  even if I clicked on Cancel the version would still remain 13:42  ok I see 13:42  Sorry again 13:42  this link is in inline edit mode right? 13:42  yes 13:42  ok 13:59  has quit 14:03  hey. can/should I attach images when mailing users@xwiki? 14:05  not recommended indeed 14:07  i'll use a link then 14:17  cjd: we have a question for you on the list :) 14:17  about "Index" vs "Directory" 14:30  sent. 14:57  has quit 15:00  has quit 15:02  has quit 15:04  has quit 15:06  has joined #xwiki 15:06  has quit 15:06  has left #xwiki 15:08  We don't fix bugs about lucene, right now, is it? 15:10  gdelhumeau: need to conclude on http://markmail.org/message/vc5igt6dj5zio3wo first 15:11  (but yes in practice none of us will take any time fixing lucene plugin bugs) 15:46  has joined #xwiki 16:07  vmassol: "[ERROR] com.xpn.xwiki.store.XWikiHibernateBaseStore: Method 'protected java.lang.String[] addHibernateSequenceIfRequired(java.lang.String[], java.lang.String, org.hibernate.Session)' has been removed" 16:07  arf 16:07  should be internal normally 16:07  yep but too old now 16:07  the method is only protected for the unit test actually…. 16:20  has joined #xwiki 16:27  has quit 16:39  has joined #xwiki 16:43  has quit 16:49  has joined #xwiki 17:14  has joined #xwiki 17:17  has quit 17:18  has joined #xwiki 17:24  Please can you answer to "Problem: migration from XEM 4.5.4 to XE 5.2-SNAPSHOT"? 17:41  has quit 17:54  has joined #xwiki 18:10  has quit 18:11  has quit 18:11  has joined #xwiki 18:11  has joined #xwiki 18:13  has joined #xwiki 18:16  has quit 18:36  has quit 18:41  has joined #xwiki 18:44  has quit 18:45  has joined #xwiki 18:45  has quit 18:45  has quit 18:48  has quit 18:50  has joined #xwiki 18:50  has quit 18:57  wow 27 BFD issues 18:57  we're at ?9 :) 18:58  (green above read) 18:58  \*red 18:58  well done, I'll send the results tonight or tomorrow morning 18:58  tomorrow morning actually 18:58  to leave the time to Sergiu and others to participate if they want 19:01  yep great BFD especially since there is not much easy bugfix anymore 19:02  well we generated quite a few but it's good to see that we're not letting them be old :) 19:02  and we're crushing them in their infancy! 19:02  no mercy to bugs 19:02  has quit 19:11  has quit 19:22  has joined #xwiki 19:22  hello 19:24  how can i get URL from an attached video? 19:25  Mariah: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HLinks 19:26  thnx i´ll check it out :) 19:37  i also try to install JW Player Macro but i got this error... Dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-wikimacro-store-5.1] is not compatible with core extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-wikimacro-store-5.0.3] 19:37  what can i do to solve this? 19:37  i want to insert a video into wiki page 19:38  i try like this: 19:39   {{velocity}} {{html wiki="true" clean="false"}} {{/html}} 19:39  but i just get audio, i cant see the video 19:48  :( 19:51  Mariah: check the generated html 19:53  u mean view source code? 19:56  yes 19:56  ok i see this: 19:57  

Presentation

19:58  as i said, i just get the audio, but i cant see the video 20:01  you should deploy xwiki under the xwiki/ directory as documented 20:01  vmassol: which email are you referring to? 20:01  (for a start) 20:02  cjd: one from today, let me try to find it again 20:02  "[Proposals] Menu improvements when Workspaces activated" 20:02  thanks 20:02  starting from Ludovic's email of today 20:02  thanks! 20:04  ahh index as in the list of users 20:05  User Directory to me means "home folder" 20:05  list of users, list of wikis, list of applications, list of documents 20:06  "Users Index" is not correct, there's just no way to express what it's getting at other than "User Index" 20:06  yep I agree but I'm not native, would be great if you could reply by mail 20:06  \*native speaker that is 20:07  good naming is tricky 20:07  yep 20:07  Directory is an overloaded term because of unix 20:07  has joined #xwiki 20:07  and it's not a per-user directory 20:13  has joined #xwiki 20:21  has quit 20:32  has quit 20:48  has joined #xwiki 21:00  has joined #xwiki 21:06  has quit 23:11  has quit 23:38  has quit
